Let `G` be a group, we prove
```lean
{ N : Subgroup G // N.Normal } â‰ƒo Con G
```

### PR summary [16ac32e820](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23269/commits/16ac32e82086ade170ce3a5b634583b7fe8ba733)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.Con.mem_subgroup_iff`
`+ _root_.Con.subgroup`
`+ _root_.Con.subgroup_quotientGroupCon`
`+ _root_.Subgroup.orderIsoCon`
`+ con_ker_eq_conKer`
`+ con_le_iff`
`+ con_mono`
`+ con_subgroup`
`+ instance (c : Con G) : c.subgroup.Normal`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: xroblot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

bors d+

Thanks!
This is basically what I was hoping for, thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!
This might overlap with #23244

I have merged #23244 locally to test that and everything was okay. 

Thanks for the review!

I think we should use
```suggestion
  carrier := { x | c x 1 }
```
here to match the `{r : R | t.ringCon r 0}` used for `TwoSidedIdeal`.
(or change `TwoSidedIdeal` if you feel it is backwards)

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := simp)]
```
This statement is backwards with respect to its name.
The forward direction (as you have here) is probably worth exposing as `con_mono` as a shorthand.

```suggestion
theorem _root_.Con.mem_subgroup_iff {c : Con G} {x : G} :
```
to read the symbols in the right order

This is misnamed, it should be
```suggestion
theorem _root_.Con.subgroup_quotientGroupCon (H : Subgroup G) [H.Normal] :
```

```suggestion
theorem con_ker_eq_conKer {M : Type*} [Monoid M] (f : G â†’* M) :
```
Can you add `simps` here?

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := simp)]
```

This will play better with `simps`:
```suggestion
  toFun N := QuotientGroup.con N
```
or perhaps with N.val on the RHS if necessary.
It doesn't work either way. Lean complains that it cannot synthesize the fact that `N` is normal.

This works:
```lean
  toFun N :=
    have : N.val.Normal := N.prop
    QuotientGroup.con N
```
`simp`?

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := gcongr)]
```
Could you check the additivized name here is correct? The last part should be `addConKer`.
This one might need a custom to_additive name too
Generated name is `AddCon.addSubgroup_quotientAddGroupCon` which looks fine to me...
Does the additive version have `AddCon` in the name?
Fixed this one.

`M` is already defined above:
```suggestion
theorem con_ker_eq_conKer (f : G â†’* M) : QuotientGroup.con f.ker = Con.ker f := by
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := simps) AddSubgroup.orderIsoAddCon
```

```suggestion
  toFun N := letI : N.val.Normal := N.prop; QuotientGroup.con N
```

pullRequest.title: feat(GroupTheory/Congruences): add the equiv between congruence relations on a group and its normal subgroup
